model.name: Balanced Forest
model.php_template:
<?php

$handle = fopen ("php://stdin", "r");
fscanf($handle, "%i",$q);
for($a0 = 0; $a0 < $q; $a0++){
    fscanf($handle, "%i",$n);
    $c_temp = fgets($handle);
    $c = explode(" ",$c_temp);
    $c = array_map('intval', $c);
    for($a1 = 0; $a1 < $n-1; $a1++){
        fscanf($handle, "%i %i", $x, $y);
    }
}

?>
model.ruby_template:
#!/bin/ruby

q = gets.strip.to_i
for a0 in (0..q-1)
    n = gets.strip.to_i
    c = gets.strip
    c = c.split(' ').map(&:to_i)
    for a1 in (0..n-1-1)
        x, y = gets.strip.split(' ')
        x = x.to_i
        y = y.to_i
    end
end
model.haskell_template:
import Control.Applicative
import Control.Monad
import System.IO


main :: IO ()
main = do
    q_temp <- getLine
    let q = read q_temp :: Int
    forM_ [1..q] $ \a0  -> do
        n_temp <- getLine
        let n = read n_temp :: Int
        c_temp <- getLine
        let c = map read $ words c_temp :: [Int]
        forM_ [1..n-1] $ \a1  -> do
            x_temp <- getLine
            let x_t = words x_temp
            let x = read $ x_t!!0 :: Int
            let y = read $ x_t!!1 :: Int

getMultipleLines :: Int -> IO [String]

getMultipleLines n
    | n <= 0 = return []
    | otherwise = do          
        x <- getLine         
        xs <- getMultipleLines (n-1)    
        let ret = (x:xs)    
        return ret
model.preview: Determine the minimum number of coins to add to a tree such that it can be cut into three trees having an equal number of coins.
model.clojure_template:
(use '[clojure.string :only (split triml)])

(
    let [
      q_t (read-line) 
      q (Integer/parseInt q_t) 
    ]

  (
    loop [a0 q]
    (when (> a0 0)

      (
        let [
          n_t (read-line) 
          n (Integer/parseInt n_t) 
        ]
      )

      (
        let [
          c_temp (read-line) 
          c_t (split c_temp #"\s+") 
          c (map #(Integer/parseInt %) c_t) 
        ]
      )

      (
        loop [a1 n-1]
        (when (> a1 0)

          (
            let [
              x_temp (read-line) 
              x_t (split x_temp #"\s+") 
              x (Integer/parseInt (x_t 0)) 
              y (Integer/parseInt (x_t 1)) 
            ]
          )

        (recur (- a1 1) ) )
      )

    (recur (- a0 1) ) )
  )

)
model.erlang_template:
-module(solution).
-export([main/0]).

main() ->

    { ok, [Q]} = io:fread("", "~d"),
    Q_list = lists:seq(1,Q),
    lists:foreach( fun(Q0) ->
            { ok, [N]} = io:fread("", "~d"),
            C = read_array(N,"~d"),
            N-1_list = lists:seq(1,N-1),
            lists:foreach( fun(N-11) ->
                    { ok, [X,Y]} = io:fread("", "~d~d")
            end,N-1_list)
    end,Q_list),
    true.

read_array(0,D) -> [];
read_array(N,D) -> 
	{ok, [X]} = io:fread("", D),
	[X | read_array(N-1,D)].

read_2darray(0,M,D) -> [];
read_2darray(N,M,D) ->
	Q=read_array(M,D),
	[Q | read_2darray(N-1,M,D)].
model.lua_template:
q = io.read("*number", "*l")
a0 = 0
while a0 < q do
    n = io.read("*number", "*l")
    c = {}
    c_temp = io.read()
    c_i = 1
    for token in string.gmatch(c_temp, "[^%s]+") do
    	c[c_i] = token
    	c_i = c_i + 1
    end
    a1 = 0
    while a1 < n-1 do
        x,y = io.read("*number", "*number", "*l")
        a1 = a1 + 1
    end
    a0 = a0 + 1
end
